1.name: OECD DAC CRS Purpose Codes (5 digit)
1.description: The sector reported corresponds to an OECD DAC CRS 5-digit purpose code

2.name: OECD DAC CRS Purpose Codes (3 digit)
2.description: The sector reported corresponds to an OECD DAC CRS 3-digit purpose code

3.name: Classification of the Functions of Government (UN)
3.description: The sector reported corresponds to the UN Classification of the Functions of Government (CoFoG)

4.name: Statistical classification of economic activities in the European Community
4.description: The sector reported corresponds to the statistical classifications of economic activities in the European Community

5.name: National Taxonomy for Exempt Entities (USA)
5.description: The sector reported corresponds to the National Taxonomy for Exempt Entities (NTEE) - USA

6.name: AidData
6.description: The sector reported corresponds to AidData classifications

7.name: SDG Goal
7.description: A value from the top-level list of UN sustainable development goals (SDGs) (e.g. ‘1’)

8.name: SDG Target
8.description: A value from the second-level list of UN sustainable development goals (SDGs) (e.g. ‘1.1’)

9.name: SDG Indicator
9.description: A value from the second-level list of UN sustainable development (SDG) indicators

10.name: Humanitarian Global Clusters (Inter-Agency Standing Committee)
10.description: The sector reported corresponds to an Inter-Agency Standard Committee Humanitarian Global Cluster code

11.name: North American Industry Classification System (NAICS)
11.description: The sector reported corresponds to the NAICS codelist

12.name: UN System Function
12.description: The sector reported corresponds to the UN System Function codelist

99.name: Reporting Organisation
99.description: The sector reported corresponds to a sector vocabulary maintained by the reporting organisation for this activity

98.name: Reporting Organisation 2
98.description: The sector reported corresponds to a sector vocabulary maintained by the reporting organisation for this activity (if they are referencing more than one)
